title: Error "No current injection point found" when using a ConfigMapping on an onStartup method
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm using quarkus 3, and I'm receiving a java.lang.IllegalStateException on this class:

```
import io.quarkus.runtime.StartupEvent;
import jakarta.enterprise.context.ApplicationScoped;
import jakarta.enterprise.event.Observes;

@ApplicationScoped
public class Bootstrapper {
    void onStartup(@Observes StartupEvent startupEvent, MyConfig myConfig) {
        System.out.println(myConfig);
    }
}
```

This is my config:
```

import io.smallrye.config.ConfigMapping;

@ConfigMapping(prefix = "my.config")
public interface MyConfig {

    int value1();

    String value2();
    
}
```

My properties:

```
my.config.value1=3
my.config.value2=hola
```

This is the exception:

```
2023-05-15 12:12:58,768 ERROR [io.qua.run.Application] (Quarkus Main Thread) Failed to start application (with profile [dev]): java.lang.IllegalStateException: No current injection point found
```

### Expected behavior

I want to eagerly instantiate a @ConfigMapping like this:

```
void onStartup(@Observes StartupEvent startupEvent, MyConfig myConfig) {
        System.out.println(myConfig);
}
```

Instead of using @Inject or a constructor.

I expected this https://quarkus.io/guides/cdi-reference#startup_event

### Actual behavior

It is not possible to inject a @ConfigMapping into an onStartup method, quarkus says "No current injection point found"

### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a new project with the scaffold
2. Create a ConfigMap like this:
```
@ConfigMapping(prefix = "my.config")
public interface MyConfig {
    int value1();
    String value2();
}
```
3. Setup the application.properties:
```
my.config.value1=3
my.config.value2=hello
```
4. Eagerly inject it by parameters in another bean:
```
void onStartup(@Observes StartupEvent startupEvent, MyConfig myConfig) {
        System.out.println(myConfig);
}
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

6.2.9-060209-generic

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.7" 2023-04-18

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.0.3.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

gradle 8.0.2

### Additional information

If you inject the config map by constructor or using @Inject it works well, this only happens injecting by parameter at `onStartup` method

P.S. This was originally posted as a [StackOverflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/q/76256554/2504224).
